cairns.david.engine

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • cairns.david.engine.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Animation class manages a series of images (frames) and the amount of time to display each frame.
    Author:
    David Cairns

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Animation.AnimFrame
      Private class to hold information about a given animation frame.

    • Method Detail

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame(java.awt.Image image,
                     long duration)
        Adds an image to the animation with the specified duration (time to display the image).
        Parameters:
        image - The image to add
        duration - The time it should be displayed for

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts this animation over from the beginning.

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        Updates this animation's current image (frame) based on how much time has elapsed.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - Time that has elapsed since last call

      • getImage

        public java.awt.Image getImage()
        Gets this Animation's current image. Returns null if this animation has no images.
        Returns:
        The current image that should be displayed

      • getFrame

        private Animation.AnimFrame getFrame(int i)
        Works out which frame to display, incorporating the offset.
        Parameters:
        i - The frame index to get
        Returns:
        The animation frame corresponding to the index

      • getFrameImage

        public java.awt.Image getFrameImage(int i)
        Gets the image associated with frame 'i'. This may be useful if you have loaded a set of images from a sprite sheet and wish to inspect the images that have been loaded.
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the frame to request
        Returns:
        A reference to the image at index 'i'

      • setLoop

        public void setLoop(boolean shouldLoop)
        Tell an animation to loop continuously or not.
        Parameters:
        shouldLoop - True if it should loop continuously.

      • hasLooped

        public boolean hasLooped()
        Has this animation looped once?
        Returns:
        True if it has looped once.

      • loadAnimationFromSheet

        public void loadAnimationFromSheet(java.lang.String fileName,
                                   int columns,
                                   int rows,
                                   int frameDuration)
        Loads a complete animation from an animation sheet and adds each frame in the sheet to the animation with the given frameDuration.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path to the file to load the animations from
        rows - How many rows there are in the sheet
        columns - How many columns there are in the sheet
        frameDuration - The duration of each frame

      • getImagesFromSheet

        private java.awt.Image[] getImagesFromSheet(java.awt.Image sheet,
                                            int columns,
                                            int rows)
        Loads a set of images from a sprite sheet so that they can be added to an animation. Courtesy of Donald Robertson.
        Parameters:
        sheet -
        rows -
        columns -
        Returns:

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the animation.

        public void pauseAt(int frame)
        Pause the animation at given 'frame'
        Parameters:
        frame -

      • play

        public void play()
        Play the animation

      • setAnimationSpeed

        public void setAnimationSpeed(float rate)
        Change the animation 'rate'. E.g. 2 would be twice as fast.
        Parameters:
        rate - The rate to animate at.

      • setAnimationFrame

        public void setAnimationFrame(int f)
        Set the animation to frame 'f'.
        Parameters:
        f - The frame to shift to.
